abstract: In this week's Critics' Picks, A. O. Scott looks back at "Detour," a 1945 film noir directed by Edgar G. Ulmer.
snippet: In this week's Critics' Picks, A. O. Scott looks back at "Detour," a 1945 film noir directed by Edgar G. Ulmer.
lead_paragraph: In this week's Critics' Picks, A. O. Scott looks back at Edgar G. Ulmer's low-budget film "Detour" (1945). The film stars Tom Neal as a struggling musician who's hitchhiking his way through California when he meets a femme fatale, played by Ann Savage.
